title: Populate the Videos tab with a simple sponsored/ad-style watch feed (frontend-only)

requirements.text: Replace the current placeholder content in `frontend/src/pages/VideosPage.tsx` with a simple, scrollable “Sponsored” video feed that gives users something to watch, using frontend-only mock ad items (no backend changes).

quotes: Is there anyway you can add Atleast ads on that part of videos Atleast for it to have something to watch

acceptanceCriteria: Navigating to the Videos tab shows a feed of at least 3 sponsored/ad-style items instead of the current “Videos is coming soon.” card.
Each feed item is clearly labeled in English as sponsored content (e.g., “Sponsored”).
Each feed item has a thumbnail image, a short title, and a short description (English).
No backend canister methods are added/changed to support this feed.

requirements.text: Implement a basic in-app “watch” experience for the sponsored items in the Videos tab (e.g., tapping an item opens a modal/sheet with a full-bleed vertical viewer that simulates playback using an animated progress indicator and item details), entirely client-side.

quotes: add Atleast ads on that part of videos Atleast for it to have something to watch

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking/tapping a sponsored item opens a dedicated viewer (modal/sheet/page section) that presents the ad item in a watchable format.
The viewer includes a visible progress indicator that advances automatically (e.g., 10–15 seconds) and provides a clear close/back control.
User-facing labels and messaging are in English and do not claim the content is from a real ad network.

requirements.text: Add a small disclaimer in the Videos tab UI clarifying that the sponsored items are sample/demo content (English), and ensure the layout works well on both mobile and desktop.

quotes: add Atleast ads on that part of videos Atleast for it to have something to watch

acceptanceCriteria: A short disclaimer appears in the Videos tab (e.g., near the top of the feed) indicating the items are sample/demo sponsored content.
The feed and viewer are responsive and usable on small mobile screens and desktop widths without horizontal overflow.

requirements.text: Add the required generated ad thumbnail images under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` and render them in the Videos tab feed items (do not fetch thumbnails via the backend).
acceptanceCriteria: All generated thumbnails exist at `frontend/public/assets/generated/` and are referenced by the Videos tab via static paths (e.g., `/assets/generated/...`).
Thumbnails render crisply (no broken images) in both light and dark mode.

constraints: Do not add or integrate third-party ad networks (no Google AdSense or similar).
Do not add new backend canisters/services; keep this change frontend-only.
Do not edit files under `frontend/src/components/ui` or other paths listed in `frontend.immutablePaths`.
Use English for all user-facing text.
nonGoals: Real monetization, payouts, impressions/click tracking, or analytics.
Server-side ad selection, targeting, or user profiling.
Uploading user videos or building full video-sharing functionality in this change.

required: Abstract sponsored video thumbnail with bold shapes and high contrast (vibechat-sponsored-1.dim_720x1280.png)
Abstract sponsored video thumbnail with product-style silhouette and clean gradients (vibechat-sponsored-2.dim_720x1280.png)
Abstract sponsored video thumbnail with dynamic pattern and minimal iconography (vibechat-sponsored-3.dim_720x1280.png)
